cause.description: PETA's goal is "total animal liberation," meaning little contact with humans if any at all. This includes all food products from animals, like milk, eggs, honey, cheese, and butter; any clothing products taken from animals, such as silk, wool, leather, cashmere, and angora; and owning animals as pets. The group encourages burglary, arson, and destruction of property in order to promote their cause. Also, hardly any of their collected donations go toward saving animals. Instead, the money goes toward paying off convicted arsonists and other criminals. Although they are radically against "unethical" treatment of animals, each year PETA kills more animals than it saves. From July 1998 to the end of 2003, PETA killed 10,000 animals. In 2005, they killed 90% of the animals they collected. Ingrid Newkirk, the president and co-creator of PETA, has even gone so far as to say that "even if animal research resulted in a cure for AIDS, we would be against it." To find out more, visit animalscam.com or consumerfreedom.com To sign the petition to have PETA's tax-exemption status removed, visit http://www.consumerfreedom.com/article_detail.cfm/article/154 Also, I would NOT recommend donating through this Facebook application.
